revised_title: Temporal Growth of Ionization in Gases: Metastable Atoms and Trapped Radiation
tldr: The authors present a mathematical treatment of the temporal growth of ionization in gases involving the action of metastable atoms and trapped radiation. They derive the continuity equation and boundary conditions, and provide solutions for the steady state and temporal growth in various exact and approximate forms. The study considers secondary cathode processes due to fluorescent light and the general case with additional diffusion processes and secondary cathode action.
